page.title: 15Oxford Street: 05290181
page.content: The British Telecom (once Post Office) Tower in the NW corner of this block provides a landmark for central London to the N of Oxford Circus. Oxford Street, the home of a branch of every British fashion chain store, remains constantly busy all year drawing customers from abroad, other parts of Britain and the 1000s of offices in the West End. The British Museum to the E of this block, houses treasures from around the world, including the Parthanon friezes which the Greek government would like to have returned to their country of origin. Not only does this area contain 100s of shops but also restaurants--238 in fact were counted by the schoolchildren of All Souls Primary in Foley Street--as well as 26 banks and 23 betting shops. Foyles Book Shop near Tottenham Ct Rd claims to be the largest in the world.
